org.opends.sdk.ldif
Class LDIFUtils

java.lang.Object
  org.opends.sdk.ldif.LDIFUtils

public final class LDIFUtils
extends Object

Common LDIF utility methods which may be used when implementing functionality that uses the LDIF format.

See Also:
RFC 2849 - The LDAP Data Interchange Format (LDIF) - Technical Specification

Method Summary
static String readDN(String ldifLine)
          Parses the provided line of LDIF as distinguished name.
static String readDN(String ldifLine, int lineNumber)
          Parses the provided line of LDIF as distinguished name.
 
Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object
clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait
 

Method Detail

readDN

public static String readDN(String ldifLine)
                     throws DecodeException
Parses the provided line of LDIF as distinguished name. This method does not check the format of the distinguished name nor does it perform any schema checking.

This method is equivalent to: 

 readDN(ldifLine, 0);

Parameters:
ldifLine - The line of LDIF which should be parsed as a distinguished name.
Returns:
The parsed distinguished name.
Throws:
DecodeException - If a problem occurs while trying to parse ldifLine as a distinguished name.

readDN

public static String readDN(String ldifLine,
                            int lineNumber)
                     throws DecodeException
Parses the provided line of LDIF as distinguished name. This method does not check the format of the distinguished name nor does it perform any schema checking.

Parameters:
ldifLine - The line of LDIF which should be parsed as a distinguished name.
lineNumber - The position of ldifLine in the associated LDIF content.
Returns:
The parsed distinguished name.
Throws:
DecodeException - If a problem occurs while trying to parse ldifLine as a distinguished name.
